title: Ezekiel Chapter 46 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 46 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 46 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 46.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:1, when shall the gate of the inner court that looketh toward the east be opened?
options: On the sabbath and the day of the new moon
Every day
Only on the sabbath
Only on the day of the new moon
questions.correctAnswer: On the sabbath and the day of the new moon
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:1 says the gate shall be shut the six working days but opened on the sabbath and the day of the new moon.

questions.question: Who shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate without and stand by the post of the gate, according to Ezekiel 46:2?
options: The prince
The priests
The people of the land
The Levites
questions.correctAnswer: The prince
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:2 states that the prince shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate without and stand by the post.

questions.question: Where shall the people of the land worship on the sabbaths and new moons according to Ezekiel 46:3?
options: At the door of the east gate
At the altar
In their homes
At the door of the inner court
questions.correctAnswer: At the door of the east gate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:3 states the people of the land shall worship at the door of this gate before the LORD on sabbaths and new moons.

questions.question: What burnt offering shall the prince offer on the sabbath day according to Ezekiel 46:4?
options: Six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish
One bullock without blemish
Seven lambs without blemish
A young bullock and two rams
questions.correctAnswer: Six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:4 says the prince shall offer six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish on the sabbath.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:6, what burnt offerings shall be prepared on the day of the new moon?
options: A young bullock without blemish, six lambs, and a ram
Six rams and a bullock
Seven lambs
A ram and two bullocks
questions.correctAnswer: A young bullock without blemish, six lambs, and a ram
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:6 states that on the day of the new moon, the burnt offering shall be a young bullock without blemish, six lambs, and a ram.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 46:9 states that people entering by the north gate during solemn feasts shall exit by the same north gate.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:9 states that one entering by the north gate shall go out by the south gate, not the same gate.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:10, where shall the prince go when the people go in and come out?
options: In the midst of the people
By a separate gate
Only by the east gate
At the head of the people
questions.correctAnswer: In the midst of the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:10 says the prince shall go in and out in the midst of the people.

questions.question: What daily burnt offering is commanded to be prepared every morning according to Ezekiel 46:13?
options: A lamb of the first year without blemish
A ram without blemish
A young bullock
Six lambs without blemish
questions.correctAnswer: A lamb of the first year without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:13 commands the daily burnt offering to be a lamb of the first year without blemish every morning.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 46:18 allows the prince to take the people's inheritance by oppression.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:18 clearly states the prince shall not take the people's inheritance by oppression.

questions.question: Where do the priests boil the trespass and sin offerings as described in Ezekiel 46:20?
options: In the holy chambers looking toward the north
In the outer court
At the altar
In the four corners of the court
questions.correctAnswer: In the holy chambers looking toward the north
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:20 states the priests shall boil the offerings in the holy chambers looking toward the north.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:23, what was made with boiling places under the rows round about the courts?
options: A row of buildings
The altar
The inner court gate
The holy chambers
questions.correctAnswer: A row of buildings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:23 describes a row of buildings round about the four corners with boiling places under the rows.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ezekiel 46:14 commands a meat offering of the ______ part of an ephah and the third part of an hin of oil every morning.
options: sixth
third
half
whole
questions.correctAnswer: sixth
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:14 specifies the meat offering every morning shall be the sixth part of an ephah and a third part of an hin of oil.

questions.question: What happens to a gift of inheritance given by the prince to one of his servants, according to Ezekiel 46:17?
options: It is theirs until the year of liberty, then it returns to the prince
It remains theirs forever
It is immediately returned to the prince
It is given to the sons of the prince
questions.correctAnswer: It is theirs until the year of liberty, then it returns to the prince
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:17 explains that inheritance given to a servant returns to the prince after the year of liberty.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 46:12 states that the prince's voluntary burnt offerings must be prepared at the same gate as on the sabbath day.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:12 says the prince's voluntary offerings are prepared at the gate looking toward the east as on the sabbath.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:5, how much oil is to be offered to an ephah of meat offering?
options: An hin of oil
A half hin of oil
A third hin of oil
Two hins of oil
questions.correctAnswer: An hin of oil
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:5 specifies an hin of oil shall be offered to an ephah of meat offering.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 46 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 46 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with maintaining a disciplined prayer life. Based on Ezekiel 46, what biblical truth would you share about daily devotion?
options: Prepare a continual burnt offering every morning as a symbol of consistent devotion
Only pray on sabbaths and new moons to honor God
Devotion should be spontaneous, not scheduled
Prayer is optional outside of church gatherings
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare a continual burnt offering every morning as a symbol of consistent devotion
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:13-15 teaches the importance of a daily burnt offering and meat offering every morning, symbolizing consistent and continual devotion to God.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 46 instruct the prince to demonstrate integrity in stewardship regarding land and inheritance?
options: He must not take the people's inheritance by oppression but give his sons inheritance from his own possession
He can take land from the people as long as it benefits the temple
He should sell the people's inheritance for profit
He should redistribute all land equally among the people
questions.correctAnswer: He must not take the people's inheritance by oppression but give his sons inheritance from his own possession
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:18 clearly states that the prince shall not oppress the people by taking their inheritance but must provide for his sons from his own property, promoting honesty and fairness.

questions.question: When the people enter the temple during solemn feasts, what does Ezekiel 46 teach about their conduct illustrating humility and order?
options: Those who enter by the north gate exit by the south gate, and vice versa, without returning the way they came
They can enter and exit by the same gate freely
They should enter only through the east gate and exit through the west gate
They must remain inside until the feast ends
questions.correctAnswer: Those who enter by the north gate exit by the south gate, and vice versa, without returning the way they came
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:9 instructs orderly movement during worship, promoting humility and respect by not retracing steps, which supports disciplined worship and fellowship.

questions.question: A believer struggles with generous giving. According to Ezekiel 46, what principle about offerings can help encourage generosity?
options: Give according to the ability of your hand, as shown in the prince's offerings
Give only when forced by tradition
Give the same fixed amount every time regardless of means
Offerings are unnecessary outside of special feast days
questions.correctAnswer: Give according to the ability of your hand, as shown in the prince's offerings
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:5,7, and 11 emphasize giving meat offerings and lambs according to what one is able, teaching generosity that reflects one's means and willingness to honor God.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 46 show the importance of worship on the Sabbath and new moon days for spiritual discipline?
options: The east gate of the inner court shall be opened for worship on these days
Worship is only allowed inside homes on these days
All gates remain shut on these days
The prince must fast and not enter the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The east gate of the inner court shall be opened for worship on these days
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:1 and 3 describe the east gate opening specifically on sabbaths and new moons, highlighting special times for corporate worship and spiritual focus.

questions.question: What lesson about humility in leadership can we learn from the prince's manner of entering and exiting the temple according to Ezekiel 46?
options: The prince enters and exits by the same gate, showing his central role among the people
The prince uses a private gate unseen by the people
The prince enters and exits only after the people have left
The prince never enters the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The prince enters and exits by the same gate, showing his central role among the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:2 and 8 show the prince entering and exiting by the porch of the east gate, symbolizing his leadership role yet also his accountability and visible worship before God and the people.

questions.question: A believer asks about persevering through times of worship and service. What does Ezekiel 46 teach about perseverance through trials in spiritual duties?
options: Burnt offerings and meat offerings are to be prepared continually, every morning without fail
Offerings can be skipped when burdensome
Worship should only happen when convenient
Service is optional and only for the gifted
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt offerings and meat offerings are to be prepared continually, every morning without fail
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:13-15 emphasize daily preparation of offerings as a perpetual ordinance, teaching perseverance and faithfulness in spiritual disciplines despite challenges.

questions.question: How does the passage in Ezekiel 46 emphasize integrity in worship and offerings during voluntary sacrifices?
options: The gate is opened for the prince to prepare burnt and peace offerings as on the Sabbath then shut after he leaves
Voluntary offerings can be made anywhere outside the temple
Offerings are allowed only on fixed feast days
The prince can enter and leave without any gate restrictions
questions.correctAnswer: The gate is opened for the prince to prepare burnt and peace offerings as on the Sabbath then shut after he leaves
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:12 teaches that voluntary offerings require proper procedures and integrity, with the east gate opened and closed appropriately, showing reverence and order in worship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 46, the prince may give a gift of inheritance to his servants permanently without it returning to the prince's possession.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:17 explains that if the prince gives a gift of inheritance to a servant, it belongs to the servant only until the year of liberty, after which it returns to the prince, ensuring stewardship and family provision.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 46 shows that the priests have dedicated places for preparing offerings to avoid defiling the outer court and the people.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:19-20 and 24 describe holy chambers and designated places for priests to boil and bake offerings, emphasizing sanctity and care in worship to protect the people.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The meat offering prepared every morning for the continual burnt offering consists of the sixth part of an _____ and the third part of an _____ of oil.
options: ephah, hin
hin, ephah
ephah, bath
bath, hin
questions.correctAnswer: ephah, hin
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:14 specifies the meat offering as the sixth part of an ephah of fine flour mixed with the third part of a hin of oil, indicating precise measurements in daily worship.

questions.question: Based on Ezekiel 46, what biblical virtue is illustrated by the prince worshiping at the threshold of the east gate before going forth?
options: Humility and reverence in leadership
Pride and self-exaltation
Indifference to worship
Secrecy in spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: Humility and reverence in leadership
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:2 describes the prince standing by the gatepost while priests prepare offerings and worshiping at the threshold, showing humble submission and reverence despite his status.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 46 teach about honesty and fairness in leadership concerning the people's possessions?
options: The prince shall not oppress the people by taking their inheritance
The prince can take any land he desires without consequence
The people must give all possessions to the prince
Inheritance is irrelevant to the prince
questions.correctAnswer: The prince shall not oppress the people by taking their inheritance
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:18 instructs that the prince must respect the people's inheritance and avoid oppression, promoting justice and integrity in leadership.

questions.question: How does the regulation of gate openings in Ezekiel 46 teach about disciplined worship and honoring God's appointed times?
options: The east gate is shut on six working days and opened on the Sabbath and new moons for worship
All gates remain open at all times
The gates open randomly without regard to days
Only the north gate is used for worship
questions.correctAnswer: The east gate is shut on six working days and opened on the Sabbath and new moons for worship
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:1 emphasizes the importance of honoring God's appointed times by opening the east gate specifically on sabbaths and new moons, teaching spiritual discipline.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46, how should believers approach the preparation and presentation of offerings to God as a reflection of integrity and faith?
options: Offerings must be without blemish and prepared carefully
Any offering, regardless of condition, is acceptable
Offerings should be made only once a year
Only grain offerings are required
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings must be without blemish and prepared carefully
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:4 and 6 specify that lambs, rams, and bullocks must be without blemish, teaching the value of purity and integrity in what is offered to God.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 46 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 46.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:1, on which days shall the gate of the inner court that looks toward the east be opened?
options: The sabbath and the day of the new moon
Every morning
Only on the sabbath
Only on feast days
questions.correctAnswer: The sabbath and the day of the new moon
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:1 states that the gate shall be shut six working days but opened on the sabbath and on the day of the new moon.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 46:2, how does the prince enter and exit the gate during his worship?
options: He enters by the porch of the gate and goes forth by the same way
He enters and exits by the north gate
He enters by the south gate and exits by the north gate
He enters and exits through the outer court
questions.correctAnswer: He enters by the porch of the gate and goes forth by the same way
questions.explanation: The prince enters by the way of the porch of that gate and goes forth by the same way, as described in Ezekiel 46:2 and reiterated in 46:8.

questions.question: What is the significance of the prince's burnt offerings on the sabbath according to Ezekiel 46:4?
options: Six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish
A young bullock and three lambs
Only one lamb without blemish
Two rams and five lambs
questions.correctAnswer: Six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:4 specifies the prince shall offer six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish as his burnt offering on the sabbath.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezekiel 46:5, the prince's meat offering for a ram is an _____, and for the lambs, according to his ability.
options: ephah
hin
shekel
cubit
questions.correctAnswer: ephah
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:5 states the meat offering shall be an ephah for a ram and for lambs as he can give.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:6, what animals must be without blemish on the day of the new moon for the offering?
options: A young bullock, six lambs, and a ram
Only lambs
Two rams and a bullock
A bullock and ten lambs
questions.correctAnswer: A young bullock, six lambs, and a ram
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:6 clearly states the offering on the new moon includes a young bullock, six lambs, and a ram, all without blemish.

questions.question: Which direction does the people of the land enter and exit during solemn feasts, as described in Ezekiel 46:9?
options: North gate entry, south gate exit and vice versa
East gate only
Same gate for entry and exit
South gate entry and exit only
questions.correctAnswer: North gate entry, south gate exit and vice versa
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:9 instructs that those entering by the north gate exit by the south gate, and those entering by the south gate exit by the north gate during solemn feasts.

questions.question: True or False: The prince is allowed to enter and exit through different gates during the people's solemn feasts.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:10 states the prince goes in and out with the people, entering and exiting by the same gate.

questions.question: What continual burnt offering is to be prepared daily according to Ezekiel 46:13?
options: A lamb of the first year without blemish
A ram without blemish
A young bullock
Six lambs without blemish
questions.correctAnswer: A lamb of the first year without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:13 mandates preparing a daily burnt offering of a lamb of the first year without blemish every morning.

questions.question: How is the prince’s inheritance treated when given to his sons, as per Ezekiel 46:16?
options: It shall be their possession by inheritance
It reverts back to the prince after a year
It must be returned to the people
It may be given to servants permanently
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be their possession by inheritance
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:16 explains that if the prince gives a gift to his sons, it becomes their permanent inheritance.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46:18, what is the prince forbidden to do regarding the people's inheritance?
options: Take it by oppression to thrust them out of possession
Give it freely to his sons
Sell it to foreigners
Use it for temple maintenance
questions.correctAnswer: Take it by oppression to thrust them out of possession
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:18 forbids the prince from taking the people's inheritance by oppression so that they are not scattered from their possessions.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the holy chambers of the priests described in Ezekiel 46:19-20?
options: To boil the trespass and sin offerings and bake the meat offering
To serve as living quarters
For storing temple treasures
For the prince’s offerings
questions.correctAnswer: To boil the trespass and sin offerings and bake the meat offering
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:19-20 identifies these chambers as places for priests to boil trespass and sin offerings and bake meat offerings to avoid bearing them out into the outer court.

questions.question: Describe the four corners of the outer court as detailed in Ezekiel 46:21-22.
options: Each corner has a court forty cubits long and thirty cubits broad, all of one measure
They are open spaces for gatherings
They hold altars for burnt offerings
They are entrance gates to the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Each corner has a court forty cubits long and thirty cubits broad, all of one measure
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:21-22 describes courts at each of the four corners of the outer court, each measuring forty cubits long and thirty cubits broad.

questions.question: What is the function of the row of buildings with boiling places around the four courts as explained in Ezekiel 46:23-24?
options: Places where ministers boil the sacrifices of the people
Living quarters for priests
Storage rooms for offerings
Meeting places for elders
questions.correctAnswer: Places where ministers boil the sacrifices of the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:23-24 states these buildings contain boiling places where ministers cook the sacrifices of the people.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 46:12 illustrate the procedural similarity between the prince's voluntary offerings and the sabbath offerings?
options: The gate is opened for him, he prepares offerings, and then the gate is shut after he leaves
He enters through the north gate and exits through the south gate
He offers only peace offerings voluntarily
He must wait outside the gate until evening
questions.correctAnswer: The gate is opened for him, he prepares offerings, and then the gate is shut after he leaves
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:12 describes the procedure where the gate facing east is opened for the prince's voluntary offerings, which are prepared as on the sabbath, and then the gate is shut after he leaves.

questions.question: The continual meat offering every morning as ordered in Ezekiel 46:14 consists of what measurements?
options: The sixth part of an ephah of fine flour and the third part of an hin of oil
One ephah of flour and one hin of oil
Half an ephah of flour and a quarter hin of oil
A full ephah of flour and a half hin of oil
questions.correctAnswer: The sixth part of an ephah of fine flour and the third part of an hin of oil
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:14 specifies the meat offering should be the sixth part of an ephah of flour tempered with the third part of a hin of oil.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 46 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 46 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46, on which days is the east gate of the inner court to be opened?
options: The Sabbath and the day of the new moon
Every day including the six working days
Only on the Sabbath
Only on the day of the new moon
questions.correctAnswer: The Sabbath and the day of the new moon
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:1 states that the gate looking toward the east shall be shut the six working days but opened on the Sabbath and the day of the new moon. This signifies sanctified times for worship, consistent with Leviticus 23:24 and Psalm 81:3 which also highlight appointed sacred times.

questions.question: What offerings does the prince bring on the Sabbath according to Ezekiel 46?
options: Six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish
One bullock and two lambs
Seven goats and a ram
Three lambs and a bullock
questions.correctAnswer: Six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:4 specifies the prince's burnt offering on the Sabbath as six lambs and a ram, all without blemish, emphasizing the holiness required in sacrificial offerings as seen also in Leviticus 1:3 and Hebrews 9:14 where the perfection of the offering points to Christ's sinless sacrifice.

questions.question: How is the meat offering related to the burnt offerings prepared by the prince on the Sabbath?
options: An ephah for a ram and as much as he can give for the lambs, with an hin of oil to an ephah
A fixed portion of two ephahs for all the lambs
No meat offering is required
Only a hin of oil is prepared
questions.correctAnswer: An ephah for a ram and as much as he can give for the lambs, with an hin of oil to an ephah
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:5 describes the meat offering accompanying the burnt offerings as proportionate and anointed with oil, reflecting the principle of consecration and dedication (Leviticus 2:1-2; Exodus 29:40). This signifies the completeness of worship and sacrifice.

questions.question: What is the significance of the prince entering and exiting by the porch of the east gate as described in Ezekiel 46?
options: It symbolizes his authorized access and leadership in worship
It shows his separation from the people
It indicates his exclusion from the inner court
It is a sign of judgment against him
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes his authorized access and leadership in worship
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:2 and 46:8 portray the prince entering and exiting by the east gate's porch, signifying his role as mediator and leader in worship. This parallels Christ as the true Prince (cf. Isaiah 9:6; Revelation 3:21) who leads His people in worship and intercession.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 46, how shall the people of the land worship on the Sabbaths and new moons?
options: At the door of the east gate before the LORD
Inside the sanctuary only
In their homes
At the north gate exclusively
questions.correctAnswer: At the door of the east gate before the LORD
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:3 states the people shall worship at the door of the east gate on Sabbaths and new moons, highlighting communal worship at a sacred appointed place. This aligns with the corporate worship principle shown in Psalm 95:6 and Luke 4:16.

questions.question: What is the prescribed burnt offering for the new moon day in Ezekiel 46?
options: A young bullock, six lambs, and a ram, all without blemish
Only one lamb without blemish
Seven bullocks and two rams
Three goats and four lambs
questions.correctAnswer: A young bullock, six lambs, and a ram, all without blemish
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:6 prescribes a young bullock, six lambs, and a ram without blemish for the new moon offering, emphasizing the perfection required in offerings, prefiguring Christ's sinlessness (1 Peter 1:19) and the completeness of worship.

questions.question: How are the gates used by the people during solemn feasts according to Ezekiel 46?
options: Entering by the north gate and exiting by the south, or vice versa, without going back the same way
Entering and exiting by the same gate
Only entering through the east gate
Exiting through the west gate only
questions.correctAnswer: Entering by the north gate and exiting by the south, or vice versa, without going back the same way
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:9 describes a regulated flow where worshipers enter one gate and exit another during solemn feasts, symbolizing order and reverence in worship, paralleling orderly worship practices recommended in 1 Corinthians 14:40 and Nehemiah 8:1-3.

questions.question: What is the principle concerning the prince's inheritance gifts to his children and servants in Ezekiel 46?
options: Gifts to sons are permanent, while gifts to servants revert at the year of liberty
Gifts to servants are permanent, while sons inherit only temporarily
All gifts revert to the prince immediately
No inheritance is allowed for sons
questions.correctAnswer: Gifts to sons are permanent, while gifts to servants revert at the year of liberty
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:16-17 explains the inheritance principle preserving family possession but limiting servant gifts to a temporary period until the year of liberty, reflecting God's justice and protection of family inheritance as in Leviticus 25:10 and Deuteronomy 15:12-18.

questions.question: What restriction is placed on the prince regarding the people's inheritance in Ezekiel 46?
options: He shall not take inheritance by oppression, but provide his sons with his own possessions
He may take any inheritance he desires
He can give the people’s inheritance to his servants
He must redistribute all inheritance to the people annually
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not take inheritance by oppression, but provide his sons with his own possessions
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:18 prohibits the prince from oppressing the people to take their inheritance, underscoring divine justice and protection of property rights, consistent with God's care for justice in Proverbs 29:4 and Isaiah 1:17.

questions.question: Where are the priests instructed to boil the trespass and sin offerings and bake the meat offerings according to Ezekiel 46?
options: In the holy chambers toward the north, not bringing them into the outer court
In the outer court
Outside the temple grounds
In the inner sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: In the holy chambers toward the north, not bringing them into the outer court
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:19-20 directs priests to perform these tasks in the holy chambers to sanctify the people, avoiding defilement of the outer court, which aligns with Levitical purity laws found in Leviticus 6:28 and 10:1-7 emphasizing holiness.

questions.question: What does the daily burnt offering of a lamb without blemish symbolize in Ezekiel 46?
options: A continual atonement and dedication to the LORD
A once-in-a-lifetime sacrifice
An offering only for the prince
A sacrifice for the temple structure
questions.correctAnswer: A continual atonement and dedication to the LORD
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:13 emphasizes the daily lamb offering without blemish as a continual burnt offering, prefiguring Christ as the Lamb offered once for all (Hebrews 10:12) and God's ongoing provision for atonement (Numbers 28:3-8).

questions.question: What is the quantity of meat offering and oil to be prepared with the daily burnt offering according to Ezekiel 46?
options: The sixth part of an ephah of fine flour and the third part of an hin of oil
One whole ephah of flour and one hin of oil
No oil is used
Only a small handful of flour and a drop of oil
questions.correctAnswer: The sixth part of an ephah of fine flour and the third part of an hin of oil
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:14 specifies these precise measurements for the daily meat offering and oil, reflecting God's detailed requirements for worship and dedication, consistent with Exodus 29:40 and Leviticus 2:1-2's emphasis on exactness in offerings.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 46 describe the role of the ministers who boil the sacrifices?
options: They boil the sacrifices in designated places to sanctify the offerings and people
They sell the sacrifices in the market
They eat the sacrifices themselves
They dispose of the sacrifices outside the city
questions.correctAnswer: They boil the sacrifices in designated places to sanctify the offerings and people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:24 states that the ministers boil the sacrifices in designated places, ensuring sanctification and proper handling, aligning with priestly duties described in Leviticus 6:28 and 10:12-13 emphasizing holiness and order in worship.

questions.question: What theological theme is reflected in the prince offering peace offerings and burnt offerings voluntarily as described in Ezekiel 46?
options: The voluntary worship and intercession reflecting Christ's mediatorial role
The prince's personal ambition
The rejection of sacrifices
The transfer of priestly duties to the people
questions.correctAnswer: The voluntary worship and intercession reflecting Christ's mediatorial role
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:12 describes the prince voluntarily offering sacrifices, symbolizing intercession and mediation, foreshadowing Christ who offered himself as a voluntary sacrifice (Hebrews 7:27; Romans 8:34), affirming the doctrine of atonement and priesthood.

questions.question: How does the order of entrance and exit during feasts in Ezekiel 46 reflect ecclesiological principles?
options: It demonstrates orderly worship and unity under a divinely appointed leadership
It shows division among the people
It indicates casual worship
It suggests exclusion of some worshipers
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates orderly worship and unity under a divinely appointed leadership
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 46:9-10 emphasizes regulated movement during worship, pointing to order and unity under the prince's leadership. This reflects New Testament church order principles found in 1 Corinthians 14:40 and Hebrews 13:17, emphasizing orderly worship under Christ as head.
